alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 6:47AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Seminole, northwestern Brevard and Volusia Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 647 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oak Hill, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Ormond Beach and DeLand. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Seminole
